message: I have a thought that I wanted to share with you guys. Does it make sense to build a recurring subscription for businesses in MENA? Something like Recurly and Chargify? From our experience people like Payfort don't give you this stuff out of the box.

data.message:
Personally, I believe there is potential, but someone has to stand-up & take the risk. I will list the list of problems that should be solved.

Big part of it is about legal restriction, but mobile carriers want to get into this area. 

Cash is still the dominant payment method, but my impression is that the upper class is increasingly using credit cards.

I suggest that you initially launch in the gulf. They've the money!

Mohammad Al-Ayouti (of Vodafone) may give you good insight as well.

I'm not suggesting building a payment gateway like Payfort or Gate2Play.  We are working with Payfort for our billing system. But we had to do all the logic related to 

- Creating different pricing tiers
- Charging people in each pricing tier the correct amount
- Sending emails confirming the charge has been done
- Managing people upgrading/downgrading their plan
- Issuing invoices

My understanding is that Chargify and Recurly do this stuff regardless of your payment gateway.
As I understand, your customers are businesses?

This is not the point. The issue is if you are trying to build a SAAS business like UserTalk, you'll have to write a lot of code that manages billing users on a monthly basis and invoicing them. Payment gateways don't really offer this out of the box. Hence the existence of businesses like Recurly and Chargify. I was asking if building something like this would be viable in the Middle East.
In other words, you're asking "How many companies in MENA uses subscription model?". I don't have an immediate answer.
Yes exactly that was my question.

I still believe that even for companies that DO NOT use a subscription model, building something on top of Payment gateways that can integrate to your system and give you good reporting on your transactions could be useful.
Ahmed do you mean something like http://www.amember.com/ ?
Muhammad Saleh not really like it. This seems to be geared more towards managing your user profiles. Recurly and Chargify are more related to recuring subscription billing
Ahmed Fathalla We @ DrBridge will definitely pay for this if you build it :)
Adel K. Khalil do you mean the recurring billing part or the transaction reporting?
